problem.markdown:
In a steam-electric power plant, 100 units of fuel are put into a boiler, which converts the fuel to 80 units of steam. The steam is then put through a turbine, which transfers 40 units to a generator. The generator is then able to generate 36 units of electricity.
>>What is the overall efficiency of this system? Round your answer to the nearest whole number. Do not include the % sign in your answer.<<
= 36
[explanation] The energy efficiency of system = ((energy output in the desired form) / (energy input)) x 100 = 36/100 x 100 = 36% [explanation]
problem.p: In a steam-electric power plant, 100 units of fuel are put into a boiler, which converts the fuel to 80 units of steam. The steam is then put through a turbine, which transfers 40 units to a generator. The generator is then able to generate 36 units of electricity.
What is the overall efficiency of this system? Round your answer to the nearest whole number. Do not include the % sign in your answer.

formulaequationinput.label: What is the overall efficiency of this system? Round your answer to the nearest whole number. Do not include the % sign in your answer.

div.p: ((energy output in the desired form) / (energy input)) x 100 = 36/100 x 100 = 36%
